result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Doucette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as a condition of probation and to be paid before all costs/fines for:
Keith D.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inforn Agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new law violations.

No contact with: co-defendant with the exception to facilitate any issue regarding the child in common and must be approved by Agent.
  Defendant my have contact with the victim Keith D. with continued approval of the victim and the Agent. 
    No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  Obtain GED/HSED.
  Maintain full time employment and/or school combination.
  Follow through with any treatment and.or counseling recommended by Agent. 
  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.
    If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non-working hours. 

4/4/2017 - Sentence credit of 8 days were granted.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit of 258 Days to be applied;

Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Court orders any outstanding restitution and costs to be paid as a condition of sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda L Doucette

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Sentencing of Revocation Hearing Transcript, 3/13/19
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Letter from Atty Paul Crawford advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Amanda L Doucette in court, in custody, with attorney Paul S. Crawford.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3.5 Years.
Initial Confinement: 18 Months.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
258 Days Credit.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Work toward her GED or HSED.

Any outstanding restitution/costs/surcharges are to be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Defendant to be transferred to Taycheedah - FORTHWITH.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
